text: Sierra Leone competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Sierra Leone entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Alie Kamara |align=left|50 m backstroke |34.66 |70 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m breaststroke |37.79 |75 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Joshua Wyse |align=left|50 m freestyle |27.17 |114 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |29.85 |86 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Tity Dumbuya |align=left|50 m freestyle |34.85 |97 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |37.90 |64 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Sierra Leone at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Sierra Leone at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
